duties_responsibilities.duty: Complete basic set-ups, operate, monitor, and make minor adjustments on CNC milling/grinding, induction, assembly, or other semi-automated equipment.
Perform minor troubleshooting on the machine and communicate quality defects to the technical staff.
Run production jobs on CNC milling/grinding, induction, assembly, or other semi-automated equipment to produce quality parts while maintaining productivity standards.
Inspect product for quality throughout production run using measuring tools and record inspection findings.
Read work orders and blueprints to identify appropriate specifications for machine setup and product quality.
Troubleshoot minor machine issues and communicate quality defects to the technical staff as needed.
Perform routine machine set-ups, changeovers, and adjustments on equipment to meet specifications.
Report accurate count of production parts, scrap, and labor hours by completing required paperwork and/or electronic entry.
Comply with 6S standards, participate in lean manufacturing activities, and cross-train by rotating to different machines and work areas.
Perform all other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or GED equivalent
